moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 B: 4. ... , Bb4 . Expected was Qf6 defending the knight on c6. Bb4 loses a tempo since the bishop has moved already.
moves.6. c3 Bd6: blocks the d-pawn. Ba5 or Be7 were better.
moves.7. Nxc6 dxc6 8. Bd3: Not the strongest move the bishop blocks the queen and is blocked by e4, e2 or c4 were better fields for the bishop.
moves.13. Qe3 Nxf1 14. Kxf1 Be6 15. Nd2 c5: b6 might have tricked him... with the idea of c5...
moves.21... Rad8 22. f3: ? Nf3 would have been better, defending the 2nd row against invasion
moves.22... h6 23. Nf5: good move... activating the knight, eyeing d4 to disrupt the rooks
moves.24... Kh7 25. Nd4 Rd6 26. Qe7 Rf6 27. Qx: Blunders; forced mate. g4, defending the king was an easy win for white.
